children.subject: Depends on who's teaching I think. Spring 2018 had really difficult exams while when I took it in Fall 2018 I did really well on exam and I usually don't in any other cs courses. Projects are kind of back to back so every two weeks you will have a project due. I think it's still relative low workload overall like higher workload than 188 but definitely less than 170.

If it's a guest lecturer outside of Berkeley, it will be rough most likely. I found it much easier than 170, finished problem sets within 4 hours, but debugging the 186 projects 2,3, and 5 took me forever, and if you're dealing with 161 or 188 deadlines, it can be really rough. that's why I wouldn't take with 2 other techs.

OP here. It's being "taught" by Hug, but he said he'd follow Hellerstein's course setup/syllabus/exam difficulty/curve for the online version of the course. FWIW Hellerstein was the one who taught in Fall 2018 (as per BerkeleyTime).

Also I was thinking my third lighter tech would be non-CS.

Original responder. I say take it with another tech and a non tech elective. Go to every discussion, it's important in this class because lectures and discussions are a great baseline for material, but you will need a lot of practice and understanding of material to do really well on exams. They aren't necessarily tricky, but you need to know little details to get correct I/Os and things of that nature.

And start projects day they are assigned. Will make your life a lot easier.

The rest of it sounds like good advice, but I won't have any required non-tech electives remaining by Fall. So it's either just the 2 CS techs, or 2 CS techs + 1 non CS tech. If I did the former, I feel like I'd be a bit behind in terms of where I would like to be with my degree.
I won't have any non-tech elective requirements* remaining by Fall.

No need to overthink.

Its not light. 3/5 projects take a while. Tests are hard. Don’t take with 2 other techs.
In Fall 2018, exams were almost entirely multiple choice or TF. Maybe 10% was short answer (i.e. how many I/Os for <x>?).
Hw 2 took me 10, 3 30 hours, 5 50 hours. Similar with most of them the people I talked to.

history.content: Some on this piazza have said that CS 186 (more specifically W186) is a relatively "light" tech, while others think it's become much heavier in recent semesters and is now more of a medium workload tech. Could anyone clarify, by answering the following couple questions? I know there are 5 project-like HW assignments, and 2 midterms + final, but was not sure how long the HWs themselves take. Are the exams straightforward or are they contrived, and how much prep do they need, on top of completing the assignments and reading lecture notes (is reading the textbook necessary)? Would it be feasible to pair a heavy project-oriented CS tech and another lighter tech with it? For reference I am very comfortable with Java, which is the language of choice for 186 I believe, so maybe that would help.
history.subject: 186 - light or not?
